main event: A military source reported a sighting of a flying disc near Reno, Nevada, on 5 Sep 1949, traveling westerly at 500-600 MPH, between 3,000 to 5,000 feet altitude, and perfectly round with curved sides coming to a smooth, round edge.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 2 minutes with clear visibility and no observed sound, smoke, contrails, exhaust, or ports or windows.
The witness, a veteran USAF gunner, had extensive flight experience and was considered to have noted details excellently despite the late reporting of the sighting.
There were multiple corroborating witnesses, as the witness's wife and sister-in-law also saw the object, with one of them claiming to have seen evenly spaced windows around the edge of the object.
The sighting was reported to police personnel who indicated that it was the fifth report of that type turned in that day, and it was intended to be forwarded through appropriate channels.
The document was addressed to the Commanding General of the Air Material Command at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, indicating the significance of the report within the military hierarchy.
witnesses: S/Sgt. Willie L. Cole, USAF, and his wife and sister-in-law
